newsitem.title: CHINA: PRESS DIGEST - Chinese newspapers - July 22.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Chinese newspapers - July 22.

text.p: Following is a summary of major Chinese political and business stories in leading newspapers, prepared by Reuters in Beijing. Reuters has not checked the stories and does not guarantee their accuracy. Telephone: (8610) 6532-1921. Fax: (8610) 6532-4978.
PEOPLE'S DAILY
- Thousands in Inner Mongolia participate in Grand Nadam Fair, celebrating 50th anniversary of establishment of the autonomous region.

- Consumer sales volume in first six months up 12.1 percent compared with same period last year. Consumer price index growth down by 5.3 percentage points year-on-year, retail price index growth down by 5.1 percentage points.
XINHUA DAILY TELEGRAPH
- Central Commission for Discipline Inspection issues directive banning Communist Party and government officials from tourism at public expense.
- Central bank says overall financial situation to end of June was good, with growth of money supply continuing to decline, foreign exchange reserves and individual deposits steadily increasing.
FINANCIAL NEWS
- Central bank issues financial data for first half
- By end-June, customs officials track down 62,000 tonnes smuggled oil products
CHINA SECURITIES
- Dragoncard network of Construction Bank of China goes into operation in major cities from July 21
- Ertan hydroelectric plant takes out 2.3 billion yuan insurance with PICC, bringing total to 10 billion yuan
ECONOMIC INFORMATION DAILY
- First Automotive output of Volkswagen Jetta cars up 45 percent in first half.
- By July 15, state purchasing of wheat reaches 18 million tonnes, up 10 percent from a year ago
- Fertiliser output reaches 13.407 million tonnes in first half, up 4.7 percent from year ago.
MARKET DAILY
- China spring silk cocoon output reaches 3.75 million tonnes
CHINA DAILY

- Fiscal revenue from January to June amounted to 390.1 billion yuan, up by 29.9 percent from a year ago. But expenditure in some areas outpaced revenue and Finance Ministry calls for serious attention to the imbalance.
- China is drafting law governing mediation work. To date there are more than one million mediation organisations in China.

- Provincial government of Shanxi to allocate special budget of eight million yuan to help reduce local birth defects. The target is that the incidence rate drop to half of that for 1996 by the year 2000.
